scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Who's there?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
line: Nay, answer me: stand, and unfold yourself.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Long live the king!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
line: Bernardo?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: He.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
line: You come most carefully upon your hour.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: 'Tis now struck twelve; get thee to bed, Francisco.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
line: For this relief much thanks: 'tis bitter cold,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
line: And I am sick at heart.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Have you had quiet guard?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
line: Not a mouse stirring.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Well, good night.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: If you do meet Horatio and Marcellus,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: The rivals of my watch, bid them make haste.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
line: I think I hear them. Stand, ho! Who's there?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Friends to this ground.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: And liegemen to the Dane.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
line: Give you good night.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: O, farewell, honest soldier:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Who hath relieved you?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
line: Bernardo has my place.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: FRANCISCO
line: Give you good night.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Holla! Bernardo!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Say,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: What, is Horatio there?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: A piece of him.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Welcome, Horatio: welcome, good Marcellus.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: What, has this thing appear'd again to-night?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: I have seen nothing.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Horatio says 'tis but our fantasy,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: And will not let belief take hold of him

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Touching this dreaded sight, twice seen of us:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Therefore I have entreated him along

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: With us to watch the minutes of this night;

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: That if again this apparition come,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: He may approve our eyes and speak to it.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Tush, tush, 'twill not appear.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Sit down awhile;

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: And let us once again assail your ears,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: That are so fortified against our story

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: What we have two nights seen.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Well, sit we down,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: And let us hear Bernardo speak of this.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Last night of all,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: When yond same star that's westward from the pole

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Had made his course to illume that part of heaven

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Where now it burns, Marcellus and myself,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: The bell then beating one,--

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Peace, break thee off; look, where it comes again!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: In the same figure, like the king that's dead.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Thou art a scholar; speak to it, Horatio.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Looks it not like the king?  mark it, Horatio.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Most like: it harrows me with fear and wonder.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: It would be spoke to.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Question it, Horatio.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: What art thou that usurp'st this time of night,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Together with that fair and warlike form

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: In which the majesty of buried Denmark

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Did sometimes march? by heaven I charge thee, speak!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: It is offended.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: See, it stalks away!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Stay! speak, speak! I charge thee, speak!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: 'Tis gone, and will not answer.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: How now, Horatio! you tremble and look pale:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Is not this something more than fantasy?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: What think you on't?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Before my God, I might not this believe

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Without the sensible and true avouch

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Of mine own eyes.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Is it not like the king?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: As thou art to thyself:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Such was the very armour he had on

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: When he the ambitious Norway combated;

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: So frown'd he once, when, in an angry parle,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: He smote the sledded Polacks on the ice.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: 'Tis strange.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Thus twice before, and jump at this dead hour,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: With martial stalk hath he gone by our watch.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: In what particular thought to work I know not;

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: But in the gross and scope of my opinion,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: This bodes some strange eruption to our state.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Good now, sit down, and tell me, he that knows,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Why this same strict and most observant watch

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: So nightly toils the subject of the land,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: And why such daily cast of brazen cannon,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: And foreign mart for implements of war;

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Why such impress of shipwrights, whose sore task

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Does not divide the Sunday from the week;

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: What might be toward, that this sweaty haste

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Doth make the night joint-labourer with the day:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Who is't that can inform me?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: That can I;

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: At least, the whisper goes so. Our last king,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Whose image even but now appear'd to us,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Was, as you know, by Fortinbras of Norway,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Thereto prick'd on by a most emulate pride,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Dared to the combat; in which our valiant Hamlet--

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: For so this side of our known world esteem'd him--

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Did slay this Fortinbras; who by a seal'd compact,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Well ratified by law and heraldry,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Did forfeit, with his life, all those his lands

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Which he stood seized of, to the conqueror:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Against the which, a moiety competent

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Was gaged by our king; which had return'd

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: To the inheritance of Fortinbras,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Had he been vanquisher; as, by the same covenant,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: And carriage of the article design'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: His fell to Hamlet. Now, sir, young Fortinbras,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Of unimproved mettle hot and full,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Hath in the skirts of Norway here and there

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Shark'd up a list of lawless resolutes,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: For food and diet, to some enterprise

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: That hath a stomach in't; which is no other--

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: As it doth well appear unto our state--

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: But to recover of us, by strong hand

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: And terms compulsatory, those foresaid lands

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: So by his father lost: and this, I take it,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Is the main motive of our preparations,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: The source of this our watch and the chief head

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Of this post-haste and romage in the land.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: I think it be no other but e'en so:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Well may it sort that this portentous figure

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: Comes armed through our watch; so like the king

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: That was and is the question of these wars.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: A mote it is to trouble the mind's eye.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: In the most high and palmy state of Rome,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: A little ere the mightiest Julius fell,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: The graves stood tenantless and the sheeted dead

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Did squeak and gibber in the Roman streets:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: As stars with trains of fire and dews of blood,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Disasters in the sun; and the moist star

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Upon whose influence Neptune's empire stands

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Was sick almost to doomsday with eclipse:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: And even the like precurse of fierce events,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: As harbingers preceding still the fates

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: And prologue to the omen coming on,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Have heaven and earth together demonstrated

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Unto our climatures and countrymen.--

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: But soft, behold! lo, where it comes again!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: I'll cross it, though it blast me. Stay, illusion!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: If thou hast any sound, or use of voice,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Speak to me:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: If there be any good thing to be done,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: That may to thee do ease and grace to me,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Speak to me:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: If thou art privy to thy country's fate,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Which, happily, foreknowing may avoid, O, speak!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Or if thou hast uphoarded in thy life

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Extorted treasure in the womb of earth,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: For which, they say, you spirits oft walk in death,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Speak of it: stay, and speak! Stop it, Marcellus.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Shall I strike at it with my partisan?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Do, if it will not stand.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: 'Tis here!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: 'Tis here!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: 'Tis gone!

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: We do it wrong, being so majestical,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: To offer it the show of violence;

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: For it is, as the air, invulnerable,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: And our vain blows malicious mockery.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: BERNARDO
line: It was about to speak, when the cock crew.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: And then it started like a guilty thing

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Upon a fearful summons. I have heard,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: The cock, that is the trumpet to the morn,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Doth with his lofty and shrill-sounding throat

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Awake the god of day; and, at his warning,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Whether in sea or fire, in earth or air,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: The extravagant and erring spirit hies

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: To his confine: and of the truth herein

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: This present object made probation.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: It faded on the crowing of the cock.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Some say that ever 'gainst that season comes

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Wherein our Saviour's birth is celebrated,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: The bird of dawning singeth all night long:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: And then, they say, no spirit dares stir abroad;

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: The nights are wholesome; then no planets strike,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: No fairy takes, nor witch hath power to charm,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: So hallow'd and so gracious is the time.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: So have I heard and do in part believe it.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: But, look, the morn, in russet mantle clad,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Walks o'er the dew of yon high eastward hill:

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Break we our watch up; and by my advice,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Let us impart what we have seen to-night

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Unto young Hamlet; for, upon my life,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: This spirit, dumb to us, will speak to him.

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Do you consent we shall acquaint him with it,

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: As needful in our loves, fitting our duty?

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Let's do't, I pray; and I this morning know

scene: SCENE I.  Elsinore. A platform before the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Where we shall find him most conveniently.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Though yet of Hamlet our dear brother's death

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The memory be green, and that it us befitted

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To bear our hearts in grief and our whole kingdom

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To be contracted in one brow of woe,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Yet so far hath discretion fought with nature

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That we with wisest sorrow think on him,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Together with remembrance of ourselves.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Therefore our sometime sister, now our queen,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The imperial jointress to this warlike state,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Have we, as 'twere with a defeated joy,--

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: With an auspicious and a dropping eye,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: With mirth in funeral and with dirge in marriage,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: In equal scale weighing delight and dole,--

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Taken to wife: nor have we herein barr'd

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Your better wisdoms, which have freely gone

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: With this affair along. For all, our thanks.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Now follows, that you know, young Fortinbras,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Holding a weak supposal of our worth,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Or thinking by our late dear brother's death

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Our state to be disjoint and out of frame,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Colleagued with the dream of his advantage,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: He hath not fail'd to pester us with message,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Importing the surrender of those lands

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Lost by his father, with all bonds of law,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To our most valiant brother. So much for him.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Now for ourself and for this time of meeting:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Thus much the business is: we have here writ

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To Norway, uncle of young Fortinbras,--

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Who, impotent and bed-rid, scarcely hears

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Of this his nephew's purpose,--to suppress

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: His further gait herein; in that the levies,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The lists and full proportions, are all made

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Out of his subject: and we here dispatch

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: You, good Cornelius, and you, Voltimand,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: For bearers of this greeting to old Norway;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Giving to you no further personal power

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To business with the king, more than the scope

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Of these delated articles allow.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Farewell, and let your haste commend your duty.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: CORNELIUS
line: In that and all things will we show our duty.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: We doubt it nothing: heartily farewell.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And now, Laertes, what's the news with you?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: You told us of some suit; what is't, Laertes?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: You cannot speak of reason to the Dane,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And loose your voice: what wouldst thou beg, Laertes,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That shall not be my offer, not thy asking?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The head is not more native to the heart,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The hand more instrumental to the mouth,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Than is the throne of Denmark to thy father.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: What wouldst thou have, Laertes?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: My dread lord,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Your leave and favour to return to France;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: From whence though willingly I came to Denmark,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: To show my duty in your coronation,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Yet now, I must confess, that duty done,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: My thoughts and wishes bend again toward France

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: And bow them to your gracious leave and pardon.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Have you your father's leave? What says Polonius?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: He hath, my lord, wrung from me my slow leave

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: By laboursome petition, and at last

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Upon his will I seal'd my hard consent:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: I do beseech you, give him leave to go.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Take thy fair hour, Laertes; time be thine,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And thy best graces spend it at thy will!

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: But now, my cousin Hamlet, and my son,--

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Aside  A little more than kin, and less than kind.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: How is it that the clouds still hang on you?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Not so, my lord; I am too much i' the sun.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Good Hamlet, cast thy nighted colour off,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: And let thine eye look like a friend on Denmark.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Do not for ever with thy vailed lids

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Seek for thy noble father in the dust:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Thou know'st 'tis common; all that lives must die,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Passing through nature to eternity.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Ay, madam, it is common.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: If it be,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Why seems it so particular with thee?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Seems, madam! nay it is; I know not 'seems.'

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: 'Tis not alone my inky cloak, good mother,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Nor customary suits of solemn black,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Nor windy suspiration of forced breath,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: No, nor the fruitful river in the eye,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Nor the dejected 'havior of the visage,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Together with all forms, moods, shapes of grief,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: That can denote me truly: these indeed seem,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: For they are actions that a man might play:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: But I have that within which passeth show;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: These but the trappings and the suits of woe.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: 'Tis sweet and commendable in your nature, Hamlet,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To give these mourning duties to your father:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: But, you must know, your father lost a father;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That father lost, lost his, and the survivor bound

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: In filial obligation for some term

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To do obsequious sorrow: but to persever

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: In obstinate condolement is a course

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Of impious stubbornness; 'tis unmanly grief;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: It shows a will most incorrect to heaven,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: A heart unfortified, a mind impatient,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: An understanding simple and unschool'd:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: For what we know must be and is as common

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: As any the most vulgar thing to sense,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Why should we in our peevish opposition

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Take it to heart? Fie! 'tis a fault to heaven,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: A fault against the dead, a fault to nature,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To reason most absurd: whose common theme

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Is death of fathers, and who still hath cried,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: From the first corse till he that died to-day,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: 'This must be so.' We pray you, throw to earth

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: This unprevailing woe, and think of us

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: As of a father: for let the world take note,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: You are the most immediate to our throne;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And with no less nobility of love

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Than that which dearest father bears his son,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Do I impart toward you. For your intent

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: In going back to school in Wittenberg,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: It is most retrograde to our desire:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And we beseech you, bend you to remain

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Here, in the cheer and comfort of our eye,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Our chiefest courtier, cousin, and our son.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Let not thy mother lose her prayers, Hamlet:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: I pray thee, stay with us; go not to Wittenberg.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I shall in all my best obey you, madam.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Why, 'tis a loving and a fair reply:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Be as ourself in Denmark. Madam, come;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: This gentle and unforced accord of Hamlet

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Sits smiling to my heart: in grace whereof,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: No jocund health that Denmark drinks to-day,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: But the great cannon to the clouds shall tell,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And the king's rouse the heavens all bruit again,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Re-speaking earthly thunder. Come away.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: O, that this too too solid flesh would melt

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Thaw and resolve itself into a dew!

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Or that the Everlasting had not fix'd

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: His canon 'gainst self-slaughter! O God! God!

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: How weary, stale, flat and unprofitable,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Seem to me all the uses of this world!

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Fie on't! ah fie! 'tis an unweeded garden,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: That grows to seed; things rank and gross in nature

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Possess it merely. That it should come to this!

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: But two months dead: nay, not so much, not two:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: So excellent a king; that was, to this,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Hyperion to a satyr; so loving to my mother

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: That he might not beteem the winds of heaven

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Visit her face too roughly. Heaven and earth!

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Must I remember? why, she would hang on him,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: As if increase of appetite had grown

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: By what it fed on: and yet, within a month--

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Let me not think on't--Frailty, thy name is woman!--

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: A little month, or ere those shoes were old

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: With which she follow'd my poor father's body,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Like Niobe, all tears:--why she, even she--

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: O, God! a beast, that wants discourse of reason,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Would have mourn'd longer--married with my uncle,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: My father's brother, but no more like my father

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Than I to Hercules: within a month:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Ere yet the salt of most unrighteous tears

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Had left the flushing in her galled eyes,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: She married. O, most wicked speed, to post

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: With such dexterity to incestuous sheets!

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: It is not nor it cannot come to good:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: But break, my heart; for I must hold my tongue.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Hail to your lordship!

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I am glad to see you well:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Horatio,--or I do forget myself.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: The same, my lord, and your poor servant ever.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Sir, my good friend; I'll change that name with you:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: And what make you from Wittenberg, Horatio? Marcellus?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: My good lord--

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I am very glad to see you. Good even, sir.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: But what, in faith, make you from Wittenberg?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: A truant disposition, good my lord.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I would not hear your enemy say so,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Nor shall you do mine ear that violence,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: To make it truster of your own report

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Against yourself: I know you are no truant.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: But what is your affair in Elsinore?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: We'll teach you to drink deep ere you depart.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: My lord, I came to see your father's funeral.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I pray thee, do not mock me, fellow-student;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I think it was to see my mother's wedding.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Indeed, my lord, it follow'd hard upon.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Thrift, thrift, Horatio! the funeral baked meats

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Did coldly furnish forth the marriage tables.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Would I had met my dearest foe in heaven

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Or ever I had seen that day, Horatio!

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: My father!--methinks I see my father.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Where, my lord?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: In my mind's eye, Horatio.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: I saw him once; he was a goodly king.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: He was a man, take him for all in all,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I shall not look upon his like again.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: My lord, I think I saw him yesternight.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Saw? who?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: My lord, the king your father.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: The king my father!

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Season your admiration for awhile

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: With an attent ear, till I may deliver,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Upon the witness of these gentlemen,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: This marvel to you.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: For God's love, let me hear.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Two nights together had these gentlemen,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Marcellus and Bernardo, on their watch,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: In the dead vast and middle of the night,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Been thus encounter'd. A figure like your father,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Armed at point exactly, cap-a-pe,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Appears before them, and with solemn march

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Goes slow and stately by them: thrice he walk'd

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: By their oppress'd and fear-surprised eyes,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Within his truncheon's length; whilst they, distilled

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Almost to jelly with the act of fear,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Stand dumb and speak not to him. This to me

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: In dreadful secrecy impart they did;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: And I with them the third night kept the watch;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Where, as they had deliver'd, both in time,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Form of the thing, each word made true and good,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: The apparition comes: I knew your father;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: These hands are not more like.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: But where was this?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: My lord, upon the platform where we watch'd.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Did you not speak to it?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: My lord, I did;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: But answer made it none: yet once methought

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: It lifted up its head and did address

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Itself to motion, like as it would speak;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: But even then the morning cock crew loud,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: And at the sound it shrunk in haste away,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: And vanish'd from our sight.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: 'Tis very strange.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: As I do live, my honour'd lord, 'tis true;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: And we did think it writ down in our duty

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: To let you know of it.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Indeed, indeed, sirs, but this troubles me.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Hold you the watch to-night?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: We do, my lord.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Arm'd, say you?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Arm'd, my lord.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: From top to toe?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: My lord, from head to foot.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Then saw you not his face?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: O, yes, my lord; he wore his beaver up.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: What, look'd he frowningly?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: A countenance more in sorrow than in anger.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Pale or red?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Nay, very pale.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: And fix'd his eyes upon you?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Most constantly.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I would I had been there.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: It would have much amazed you.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Very like, very like. Stay'd it long?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: While one with moderate haste might tell a hundred.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Longer, longer.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Not when I saw't.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: His beard was grizzled--no?

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: It was, as I have seen it in his life,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: A sable silver'd.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I will watch to-night;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Perchance 'twill walk again.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: I warrant it will.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: If it assume my noble father's person,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I'll speak to it, though hell itself should gape

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: And bid me hold my peace. I pray you all,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: If you have hitherto conceal'd this sight,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Let it be tenable in your silence still;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: And whatsoever else shall hap to-night,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Give it an understanding, but no tongue:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I will requite your loves. So, fare you well:

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Upon the platform, 'twixt eleven and twelve,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I'll visit you.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: All
line: Our duty to your honour.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Your loves, as mine to you: farewell.

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: My father's spirit in arms! all is not well;

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I doubt some foul play: would the night were come!

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.

line: Till then sit still, my soul: foul deeds will rise,

scene: SCENE II.  A room of state in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Though all the earth o'erwhelm them, to men's eyes.

line: My necessaries are embark'd: farewell:

line: For Hamlet and the trifling of his favour,

line: Hold it a fashion and a toy in blood,

line: A violet in the youth of primy nature,
