speaker: HAMLET
line: So be it!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Within  Hillo, ho, ho, my lord!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Hillo, ho, ho, boy! come, bird, come.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: How is't, my noble lord?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: What news, my lord?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: O, wonderful!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Good my lord, tell it.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: No; you'll reveal it.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Not I, my lord, by heaven.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Nor I, my lord.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: How say you, then; would heart of man once think it?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: But you'll be secret?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Ay, by heaven, my lord.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: There's ne'er a villain dwelling in all Denmark

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: But he's an arrant knave.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: There needs no ghost, my lord, come from the grave

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: To tell us this.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Why, right; you are i' the right;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: And so, without more circumstance at all,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I hold it fit that we shake hands and part:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: You, as your business and desire shall point you;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: For every man has business and desire,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Such as it is; and for mine own poor part,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Look you, I'll go pray.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: These are but wild and whirling words, my lord.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: I'm sorry they offend you, heartily;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Yes, 'faith heartily.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: There's no offence, my lord.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Yes, by Saint Patrick, but there is, Horatio,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: And much offence too. Touching this vision here,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: It is an honest ghost, that let me tell you:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: For your desire to know what is between us,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: O'ermaster 't as you may. And now, good friends,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: As you are friends, scholars and soldiers,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Give me one poor request.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: What is't, my lord? we will.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Never make known what you have seen to-night.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: My lord, we will not.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Nay, but swear't.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: In faith,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: My lord, not I.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: Nor I, my lord, in faith.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Upon my sword.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: MARCELLUS
line: We have sworn, my lord, already.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Indeed, upon my sword, indeed.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: Ghost
line: Beneath  Swear.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Ah, ha, boy! say'st thou so? art thou there,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: truepenny?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Come on--you hear this fellow in the cellarage--

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Consent to swear.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Propose the oath, my lord.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Never to speak of this that you have seen,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Swear by my sword.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: Ghost
line: Beneath  Swear.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Hic et ubique? then we'll shift our ground.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Come hither, gentlemen,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: And lay your hands again upon my sword:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Never to speak of this that you have heard,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Swear by my sword.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: Ghost
line: Beneath  Swear.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Well said, old mole! canst work i' the earth so fast?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: A worthy pioner! Once more remove, good friends.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HORATIO
line: O day and night, but this is wondrous strange!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: And therefore as a stranger give it welcome.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: There are more things in heaven and earth, Horatio,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Than are dreamt of in your philosophy. But come;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Here, as before, never, so help you mercy,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: How strange or odd soe'er I bear myself,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: As I perchance hereafter shall think meet

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: To put an antic disposition on,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: That you, at such times seeing me, never shall,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: With arms encumber'd thus, or this headshake,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Or by pronouncing of some doubtful phrase,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: As 'Well, well, we know,' or 'We could, an if we would,'

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Or 'If we list to speak,' or 'There be, an if they might,'

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Or such ambiguous giving out, to note

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: That you know aught of me: this not to do,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: So grace and mercy at your most need help you, Swear.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: Ghost
line: Beneath  Swear.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Rest, rest, perturbed spirit!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: So, gentlemen,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: With all my love I do commend me to you:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: And what so poor a man as Hamlet is

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: May do, to express his love and friending to you,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: God willing, shall not lack. Let us go in together;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: And still your fingers on your lips, I pray.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: The time is out of joint: O cursed spite,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: That ever I was born to set it right!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the platform.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Nay, come, let's go together.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Give him this money and these notes, Reynaldo.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: I will, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: You shall do marvellous wisely, good Reynaldo,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Before you visit him, to make inquire

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Of his behavior.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: My lord, I did intend it.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Marry, well said; very well said. Look you, sir,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Inquire me first what Danskers are in Paris;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And how, and who, what means, and where they keep,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: What company, at what expense; and finding

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: By this encompassment and drift of question

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: That they do know my son, come you more nearer

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Than your particular demands will touch it:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Take you, as 'twere, some distant knowledge of him;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: As thus, 'I know his father and his friends,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And in part him: ' do you mark this, Reynaldo?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: Ay, very well, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: 'And in part him; but' you may say 'not well:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: But, if't be he I mean, he's very wild;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Addicted so and so:' and there put on him

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: What forgeries you please; marry, none so rank

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: As may dishonour him; take heed of that;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: But, sir, such wanton, wild and usual slips

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: As are companions noted and most known

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: To youth and liberty.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: As gaming, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Ay, or drinking, fencing, swearing, quarrelling,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Drabbing: you may go so far.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: My lord, that would dishonour him.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: 'Faith, no; as you may season it in the charge

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: You must not put another scandal on him,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: That he is open to incontinency;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: That's not my meaning: but breathe his faults so quaintly

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: That they may seem the taints of liberty,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: The flash and outbreak of a fiery mind,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: A savageness in unreclaimed blood,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Of general assault.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: But, my good lord,--

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Wherefore should you do this?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: Ay, my lord,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: I would know that.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Marry, sir, here's my drift;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And I believe, it is a fetch of wit:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: You laying these slight sullies on my son,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: As 'twere a thing a little soil'd i' the working, Mark you,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Your party in converse, him you would sound,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Having ever seen in the prenominate crimes

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: The youth you breathe of guilty, be assured

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: He closes with you in this consequence;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: 'Good sir,' or so, or 'friend,' or 'gentleman,'

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: According to the phrase or the addition

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Of man and country.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: Very good, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And then, sir, does he this--he does--what was I

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: about to say? By the mass, I was about to say

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: something: where did I leave?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: At 'closes in the consequence,' at 'friend or so,'

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: and 'gentleman.'

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: At 'closes in the consequence,' ay, marry;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: He closes thus: 'I know the gentleman;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: I saw him yesterday, or t' other day,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Or then, or then; with such, or such; and, as you say,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: There was a' gaming; there o'ertook in's rouse;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: There falling out at tennis:' or perchance,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: 'I saw him enter such a house of sale,'

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Videlicet, a brothel, or so forth.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: See you now;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Your bait of falsehood takes this carp of truth:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And thus do we of wisdom and of reach,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: With windlasses and with assays of bias,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: By indirections find directions out:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: So by my former lecture and advice,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Shall you my son. You have me, have you not?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: My lord, I have.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: God be wi' you; fare you well.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: Good my lord!

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Observe his inclination in yourself.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: I shall, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And let him ply his music.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: REYNALDO
line: Well, my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Farewell!

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: How now, Ophelia! what's the matter?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: O, my lord, my lord, I have been so affrighted!

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: With what, i' the name of God?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: My lord, as I was sewing in my closet,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: Lord Hamlet, with his doublet all unbraced;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: No hat upon his head; his stockings foul'd,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: Ungarter'd, and down-gyved to his ancle;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: Pale as his shirt; his knees knocking each other;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: And with a look so piteous in purport

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: As if he had been loosed out of hell

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: To speak of horrors,--he comes before me.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Mad for thy love?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: My lord, I do not know;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: But truly, I do fear it.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: What said he?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: He took me by the wrist and held me hard;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: Then goes he to the length of all his arm;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: And, with his other hand thus o'er his brow,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: He falls to such perusal of my face

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: As he would draw it. Long stay'd he so;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: At last, a little shaking of mine arm

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: And thrice his head thus waving up and down,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: He raised a sigh so piteous and profound

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: As it did seem to shatter all his bulk

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: And end his being: that done, he lets me go:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: And, with his head over his shoulder turn'd,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: He seem'd to find his way without his eyes;

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: For out o' doors he went without their helps,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: And, to the last, bended their light on me.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Come, go with me: I will go seek the king.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: This is the very ecstasy of love,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Whose violent property fordoes itself

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And leads the will to desperate undertakings

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: As oft as any passion under heaven

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: That does afflict our natures. I am sorry.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: What, have you given him any hard words of late?

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: No, my good lord, but, as you did command,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: I did repel his fetters and denied

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: His access to me.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: That hath made him mad.

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: I am sorry that with better heed and judgment

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: I had not quoted him: I fear'd he did but trifle,

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And meant to wreck thee; but, beshrew my jealousy!

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: By heaven, it is as proper to our age

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: To cast beyond ourselves in our opinions

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: As it is common for the younger sort

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: To lack discretion. Come, go we to the king:

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: This must be known; which, being kept close, might

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: move

scene: SCENE I.  A room in POLONIUS' house.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: More grief to hide than hate to utter love.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Welcome, dear Rosencrantz and Guildenstern!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Moreover that we much did long to see you,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The need we have to use you did provoke

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Our hasty sending. Something have you heard

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Of Hamlet's transformation; so call it,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Sith nor the exterior nor the inward man

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Resembles that it was. What it should be,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: More than his father's death, that thus hath put him

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: So much from the understanding of himself,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: I cannot dream of: I entreat you both,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That, being of so young days brought up with him,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And sith so neighbour'd to his youth and havior,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That you vouchsafe your rest here in our court

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Some little time: so by your companies

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To draw him on to pleasures, and to gather,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: So much as from occasion you may glean,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Whether aught, to us unknown, afflicts him thus,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That, open'd, lies within our remedy.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Good gentlemen, he hath much talk'd of you;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: And sure I am two men there are not living

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: To whom he more adheres. If it will please you

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: To show us so much gentry and good will

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: As to expend your time with us awhile,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: For the supply and profit of our hope,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Your visitation shall receive such thanks

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: As fits a king's remembrance.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Both your majesties

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Might, by the sovereign power you have of us,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Put your dread pleasures more into command

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: ROSENCRANTZ
line: Than to entreaty.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: GUILDENSTERN
line: But we both obey,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: GUILDENSTERN
line: And here give up ourselves, in the full bent

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: GUILDENSTERN
line: To lay our service freely at your feet,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: GUILDENSTERN
line: To be commanded.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Thanks, Rosencrantz and gentle Guildenstern.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Thanks, Guildenstern and gentle Rosencrantz:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: And I beseech you instantly to visit

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: My too much changed son. Go, some of you,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: And bring these gentlemen where Hamlet is.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: GUILDENSTERN
line: Heavens make our presence and our practises

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: GUILDENSTERN
line: Pleasant and helpful to him!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Ay, amen!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: The ambassadors from Norway, my good lord,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Are joyfully return'd.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Thou still hast been the father of good news.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Have I, my lord? I assure my good liege,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: I hold my duty, as I hold my soul,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Both to my God and to my gracious king:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And I do think, or else this brain of mine

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Hunts not the trail of policy so sure

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: As it hath used to do, that I have found

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: The very cause of Hamlet's lunacy.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: O, speak of that; that do I long to hear.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Give first admittance to the ambassadors;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: My news shall be the fruit to that great feast.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Thyself do grace to them, and bring them in.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: He tells me, my dear Gertrude, he hath found

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: The head and source of all your son's distemper.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: I doubt it is no other but the main;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: His father's death, and our o'erhasty marriage.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Well, we shall sift him.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Welcome, my good friends!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Say, Voltimand, what from our brother Norway?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: Most fair return of greetings and desires.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: Upon our first, he sent out to suppress

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: His nephew's levies; which to him appear'd

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: To be a preparation 'gainst the Polack;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: But, better look'd into, he truly found

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: It was against your highness: whereat grieved,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: That so his sickness, age and impotence

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: Was falsely borne in hand, sends out arrests

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: On Fortinbras; which he, in brief, obeys;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: Receives rebuke from Norway, and in fine

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: Makes vow before his uncle never more

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: To give the assay of arms against your majesty.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: Whereon old Norway, overcome with joy,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: Gives him three thousand crowns in annual fee,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: And his commission to employ those soldiers,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: So levied as before, against the Polack:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: With an entreaty, herein further shown,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: That it might please you to give quiet pass

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: Through your dominions for this enterprise,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: On such regards of safety and allowance

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: VOLTIMAND
line: As therein are set down.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: It likes us well;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And at our more consider'd time well read,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Answer, and think upon this business.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Meantime we thank you for your well-took labour:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Go to your rest; at night we'll feast together:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Most welcome home!

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: This business is well ended.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: My liege, and madam, to expostulate

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: What majesty should be, what duty is,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Why day is day, night night, and time is time,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Were nothing but to waste night, day and time.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Therefore, since brevity is the soul of wit,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And tediousness the limbs and outward flourishes,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: I will be brief: your noble son is mad:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Mad call I it; for, to define true madness,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: What is't but to be nothing else but mad?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: But let that go.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: More matter, with less art.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Madam, I swear I use no art at all.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: That he is mad, 'tis true: 'tis true 'tis pity;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And pity 'tis 'tis true: a foolish figure;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: But farewell it, for I will use no art.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Mad let us grant him, then: and now remains

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: That we find out the cause of this effect,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Or rather say, the cause of this defect,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: For this effect defective comes by cause:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Thus it remains, and the remainder thus. Perpend.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: I have a daughter--have while she is mine--

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Who, in her duty and obedience, mark,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Hath given me this: now gather, and surmise.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: 'To the celestial and my soul's idol, the most

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: beautified Ophelia,'--

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: That's an ill phrase, a vile phrase; 'beautified' is

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: a vile phrase: but you shall hear. Thus:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: 'In her excellent white bosom, these, &c.'

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: Came this from Hamlet to her?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Good madam, stay awhile; I will be faithful.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: 'Doubt thou the stars are fire;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Doubt that the sun doth move;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Doubt truth to be a liar;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: But never doubt I love.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: 'O dear Ophelia, I am ill at these numbers;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: I have not art to reckon my groans: but that

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: I love thee best, O most best, believe it. Adieu.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: 'Thine evermore most dear lady, whilst

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: this machine is to him, HAMLET.'

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: This, in obedience, hath my daughter shown me,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And more above, hath his solicitings,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: As they fell out by time, by means and place,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: All given to mine ear.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: But how hath she

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Received his love?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: What do you think of me?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: As of a man faithful and honourable.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: I would fain prove so. But what might you think,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: When I had seen this hot love on the wing--

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: As I perceived it, I must tell you that,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Before my daughter told me--what might you,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Or my dear majesty your queen here, think,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: If I had play'd the desk or table-book,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Or given my heart a winking, mute and dumb,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Or look'd upon this love with idle sight;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: What might you think? No, I went round to work,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And my young mistress thus I did bespeak:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: 'Lord Hamlet is a prince, out of thy star;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: This must not be:' and then I precepts gave her,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: That she should lock herself from his resort,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Admit no messengers, receive no tokens.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Which done, she took the fruits of my advice;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And he, repulsed--a short tale to make--

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Fell into a sadness, then into a fast,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Thence to a watch, thence into a weakness,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Thence to a lightness, and, by this declension,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Into the madness wherein now he raves,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And all we mourn for.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Do you think 'tis this?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: It may be, very likely.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Hath there been such a time--I'd fain know that--

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: That I have positively said 'Tis so,'

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: When it proved otherwise?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Not that I know.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Pointing to his head and shoulder

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Take this from this, if this be otherwise:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: If circumstances lead me, I will find

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Where truth is hid, though it were hid indeed

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Within the centre.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: How may we try it further?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: You know, sometimes he walks four hours together

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Here in the lobby.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: So he does indeed.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: At such a time I'll loose my daughter to him:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Be you and I behind an arras then;

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Mark the encounter: if he love her not

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: And be not from his reason fall'n thereon,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Let me be no assistant for a state,

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: But keep a farm and carters.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: We will try it.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
line: But, look, where sadly the poor wretch comes reading.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Away, I do beseech you, both away:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: I'll board him presently.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: O, give me leave:

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: How does my good Lord Hamlet?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Well, God-a-mercy.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Do you know me, my lord?

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Excellent well; you are a fishmonger.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: LORD POLONIUS
line: Not I, my lord.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.
speaker: HAMLET
line: Then I would you were so honest a man.

scene: SCENE II.  A room in the castle.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Let him demand his fill.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: How came he dead? I'll not be juggled with:

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: To hell, allegiance! vows, to the blackest devil!

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Conscience and grace, to the profoundest pit!

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: I dare damnation. To this point I stand,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: That both the worlds I give to negligence,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Let come what comes; only I'll be revenged

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Most thoroughly for my father.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Who shall stay you?

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: My will, not all the world:

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: And for my means, I'll husband them so well,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: They shall go far with little.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Good Laertes,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: If you desire to know the certainty

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Of your dear father's death, is't writ in your revenge,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That, swoopstake, you will draw both friend and foe,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Winner and loser?

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: None but his enemies.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Will you know them then?

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: To his good friends thus wide I'll ope my arms;

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: And like the kind life-rendering pelican,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Repast them with my blood.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Why, now you speak

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Like a good child and a true gentleman.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That I am guiltless of your father's death,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And am most sensible in grief for it,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: It shall as level to your judgment pierce

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: As day does to your eye.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: Danes
line: Within                Let her come in.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: How now! what noise is that?

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: O heat, dry up my brains! tears seven times salt,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Burn out the sense and virtue of mine eye!

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: By heaven, thy madness shall be paid by weight,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Till our scale turn the beam. O rose of May!

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Dear maid, kind sister, sweet Ophelia!

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: O heavens! is't possible, a young maid's wits

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Should be as moral as an old man's life?

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Nature is fine in love, and where 'tis fine,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: It sends some precious instance of itself

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: After the thing it loves.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: Sings

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: They bore him barefaced on the bier;

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: Hey non nonny, nonny, hey nonny;

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: And in his grave rain'd many a tear:--

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: Fare you well, my dove!

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Hadst thou thy wits, and didst persuade revenge,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: It could not move thus.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: Sings

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: You must sing a-down a-down,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: An you call him a-down-a.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: O, how the wheel becomes it! It is the false

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: steward, that stole his master's daughter.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: This nothing's more than matter.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: There's rosemary, that's for remembrance; pray,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: love, remember: and there is pansies. that's for thoughts.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: A document in madness, thoughts and remembrance fitted.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: There's fennel for you, and columbines: there's rue

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: for you; and here's some for me: we may call it

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: herb-grace o' Sundays: O you must wear your rue with

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: a difference. There's a daisy: I would give you

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: some violets, but they withered all when my father

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: died: they say he made a good end,--

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: For bonny sweet Robin is all my joy.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Thought and affliction, passion, hell itself,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: She turns to favour and to prettiness.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: Sings

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: And will he not come again?

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: And will he not come again?

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: No, no, he is dead:

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: Go to thy death-bed:

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: He never will come again.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: His beard was as white as snow,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: All flaxen was his poll:

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: He is gone, he is gone,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: And we cast away moan:

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: God ha' mercy on his soul!

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: OPHELIA
line: And of all Christian souls, I pray God. God be wi' ye.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Do you see this, O God?

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Laertes, I must commune with your grief,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Or you deny me right. Go but apart,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Make choice of whom your wisest friends you will.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And they shall hear and judge 'twixt you and me:

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: If by direct or by collateral hand

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: They find us touch'd, we will our kingdom give,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Our crown, our life, and all that we can ours,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To you in satisfaction; but if not,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Be you content to lend your patience to us,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And we shall jointly labour with your soul

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To give it due content.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Let this be so;

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: His means of death, his obscure funeral--

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: No trophy, sword, nor hatchment o'er his bones,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: No noble rite nor formal ostentation--

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Cry to be heard, as 'twere from heaven to earth,

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: That I must call't in question.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: So you shall;

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And where the offence is let the great axe fall.

scene: SCENE V.  Elsinore. A room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: I pray you, go with me.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: What are they that would speak with me?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: Servant
line: Sailors, sir: they say they have letters for you.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Let them come in.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: I do not know from what part of the world

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: I should be greeted, if not from Lord Hamlet.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: First Sailor
line: God bless you, sir.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Let him bless thee too.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: First Sailor
line: He shall, sir, an't please him. There's a letter for

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: First Sailor
line: you, sir; it comes from the ambassador that was

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: First Sailor
line: bound for England; if your name be Horatio, as I am

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: First Sailor
line: let to know it is.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Reads  'Horatio, when thou shalt have overlooked

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: this, give these fellows some means to the king:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: they have letters for him. Ere we were two days old

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: at sea, a pirate of very warlike appointment gave us

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: chase. Finding ourselves too slow of sail, we put on

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: a compelled valour, and in the grapple I boarded

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: them: on the instant they got clear of our ship; so

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: I alone became their prisoner. They have dealt with

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: me like thieves of mercy: but they knew what they

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: did; I am to do a good turn for them. Let the king

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: have the letters I have sent; and repair thou to me

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: with as much speed as thou wouldst fly death. I

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: have words to speak in thine ear will make thee

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: dumb; yet are they much too light for the bore of

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: the matter. These good fellows will bring thee

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: where I am. Rosencrantz and Guildenstern hold their

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: course for England: of them I have much to tell

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: thee. Farewell.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: 'He that thou knowest thine, HAMLET.'

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: Come, I will make you way for these your letters;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: And do't the speedier, that you may direct me

scene: SCENE VI.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: HORATIO
line: To him from whom you brought them.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Now must your conscience my acquaintance seal,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And you must put me in your heart for friend,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Sith you have heard, and with a knowing ear,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That he which hath your noble father slain

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Pursued my life.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: It well appears: but tell me

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Why you proceeded not against these feats,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: So crimeful and so capital in nature,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: As by your safety, wisdom, all things else,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: You mainly were stirr'd up.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: O, for two special reasons;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Which may to you, perhaps, seem much unsinew'd,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: But yet to me they are strong. The queen his mother

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Lives almost by his looks; and for myself--

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: My virtue or my plague, be it either which--

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: She's so conjunctive to my life and soul,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That, as the star moves not but in his sphere,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: I could not but by her. The other motive,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Why to a public count I might not go,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Is the great love the general gender bear him;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Who, dipping all his faults in their affection,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Would, like the spring that turneth wood to stone,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Convert his gyves to graces; so that my arrows,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Too slightly timber'd for so loud a wind,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Would have reverted to my bow again,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And not where I had aim'd them.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: And so have I a noble father lost;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: A sister driven into desperate terms,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Whose worth, if praises may go back again,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Stood challenger on mount of all the age

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: For her perfections: but my revenge will come.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Break not your sleeps for that: you must not think

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That we are made of stuff so flat and dull

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: That we can let our beard be shook with danger

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And think it pastime. You shortly shall hear more:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: I loved your father, and we love ourself;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And that, I hope, will teach you to imagine--

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: How now! what news?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: Messenger
line: Letters, my lord, from Hamlet:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: Messenger
line: This to your majesty; this to the queen.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: From Hamlet! who brought them?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: Messenger
line: Sailors, my lord, they say; I saw them not:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: Messenger
line: They were given me by Claudio; he received them

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: Messenger
line: Of him that brought them.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Laertes, you shall hear them. Leave us.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: 'High and mighty, You shall know I am set naked on

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: your kingdom. To-morrow shall I beg leave to see

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: your kingly eyes: when I shall, first asking your

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: pardon thereunto, recount the occasion of my sudden

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: and more strange return.                  'HAMLET.'

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: What should this mean? Are all the rest come back?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Or is it some abuse, and no such thing?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Know you the hand?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: 'Tis Hamlets character. 'Naked!

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: And in a postscript here, he says 'alone.'

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Can you advise me?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: I'm lost in it, my lord. But let him come;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: It warms the very sickness in my heart,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: That I shall live and tell him to his teeth,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: 'Thus didest thou.'

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: If it be so, Laertes--

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: As how should it be so? how otherwise?--

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: Will you be ruled by me?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: Ay, my lord;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: LAERTES
line: So you will not o'errule me to a peace.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To thine own peace. If he be now return'd,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: As checking at his voyage, and that he means

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: No more to undertake it, I will work him

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
line: To an exploit, now ripe in my device,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another room in the castle.
speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
